AboutScreen.about_text:
"DaKanji" helps students of the Japanese language and people who use it.
"DaKanji" is available for, [iOS]({APPSTORE_PAGE}), [Android]({PLAYSTORE_PAGE}), [MacOS]({MACSTORE_PAGE}), [Linux (Snap)]({SNAPSTORE_PAGE}), [Windows]({MICROSOFT_STORE_PAGE}).
You can also find all releases on [GitHub.]({GITHUB_RELEASES_PAGE}).

Also check out [my other apps.]({DAAPPLAB_STORE_PAGE})
If you have problems using this app or suggestions on how to improve it please report them [here]({GITHUB_ISSUES}), join the [discord server]({DISCORD_SERVER}), or use the feedback menu to send an annotated screenshot.

The privacy policy can be found [here]({PRIVACY_POLICE})
AboutScreen.title: About

ClipboardScreen.title: Clipboard
ClipboardScreen.tutorial_android_limitation: On Android, this screen cannot automatically read your clipboard in the background. You need to have the app in the foreground. On iOS, you can allow DaKanji to read your clipboard in the settings. This way it will not always ask you to allow pasting. Sorry for the inconvenience.
ClipboardScreen.tutorial_begin_text: We will show you a quick tutorial to get you started.
ClipboardScreen.tutorial_explanation: Just copy some text and DaKanji will show dictionary entries and more!
ClipboardScreen.tutorial_pin_button: This button makes DaKanji show always on top of other windows. Additionally, the size is reduced and the frame and appbar are hidden. With this DaKanji can be used as a reading aid over any other application.

DictionaryScreen.title: Dictionary
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_begin_text: We will show you a quick tutorial to get you started.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_examples_tab: Lastly, the examples tab shows you some example sentences that use the selected word.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_kanji_tab: The Kanji-tab includes information about the Kanjis used in the word. This includes stroke order, count and meanings.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_search_filter_text: This button lets you apply filter to your search.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_search_input_clear_text: This button clears the input or pastes the text from your clipboard.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_search_input_draw_text: This button opens a screen in which you can draw Kanjis to add them to the search query.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_search_input_text: This is the search input field, just tap on it to input any word you would like to search.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_search_input_wildcards_text: You can use ? to match any single character and you can use * to match 0 to infinite characters.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_search_radical_text: This button lets you search kanji by radical.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_word_tab: This tab includes various information about the selected search result, such as conjugations and translations. The languages of the translations can be chosen in the settings.
DictionaryScreen.word_conj_verb_causative_passive_m: Is [not] made / will [not] be made to do (by someone)
DictionaryScreen.word_conj_verb_conditional_m: If X were [not] to do, when X does [not] do
DictionaryScreen.word_conj_verb_potential_m: [Not] be able to do, can [not] do
DictionaryScreen.word_conj_verb_provisional_m: If X does [not do], if X is [not]

DojgScreen.dojg_import: Tap to import the DoJG Deck
DojgScreen.dojg_import_fail:
The import failed, please assure that you are importing the correct data (the file extension should be '.apkg').
Refer to the manual for more details.
DojgScreen.dojg_import_success: DoJG has been imported successfully! Resetarting the app...

DojgScreen.tutorial_begin_title: Welcome to the Dictionary of Japanese Grammar (DoJG) screen!
DojgScreen.tutorial_results: If you found a grammar point that interests you, click on it to see all its details.
DojgScreen.tutorial_search: Enter any Japanese grammar point or its English meaning here to search for it.
DojgScreen.tutorial_volumes: You can hide the contents of volumes of the DoJG with these buttons.

DrawScreen.tutorial_dictionary_settings: In the settings the translation service can be chosen
DrawScreen.tutorial_double_tap_prediction: A Double Tap adds the character to the search box
DrawScreen.tutorial_long_press_prediction: A long press opens the prediction in a dictionary
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search: Here you can search multiple characters at once
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search_double_tap: A double tap empties the field
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search_long_press: A long press opens the characters in a dictionary
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search_short_press: A short press copies the characters to the clipboard
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search_swipe_left: Swiping left on this field deletes the last character
DrawScreen.tutorial_predictions: The predicted characters will be shown here

HomeScreen.RatePopup_text:
Do you like "DaKanji"?
If that is the case a rating would be awesome and it would help this project a lot!

KanaTableScreen.title: Kana Table
KanaTableScreen.tutorial_begin_text: We will show you a quick tutorial to get you started.
KanaTableScreen.tutorial_begin_title: Welcome to the kana table screen!
KanaTableScreen.tutorial_kana_table: Tap on any Kana to show more details about this Kana and hear its pronounciation.
KanaTableScreen.tutorial_speed_dial: This button can be used to change which Kana are shown.
KanaTableScreen.tutorial_speed_dial_dakuten: This button toggles between Dakuten on and off.
KanaTableScreen.tutorial_speed_dial_kana: This button switches between Katakana and Hiragana.
KanaTableScreen.tutorial_speed_dial_romaji: This button toggles Romaji on or off.
KanaTableScreen.tutorial_speed_dial_yoon: This button toggles Yoon characters on and off.
KanaTableScreen.tutorial_speed_dial_yoon_special: This button toggles between rare Yoon characters on or off.

KanjiTableScreen.title: Kanji Table
KanjiTableScreen.tutorial_begin_text: We will show you a quick tutorial to get you started.
KanjiTableScreen.tutorial_begin_title: Welcome to the kanji table screen!
KanjiTableScreen.tutorial_filter: This dropdown lets you select a way of filtering Kanji.
KanjiTableScreen.tutorial_filter_sub_group: This menu lets you select a sub-filter corresponding to the selection in the previous menu.
KanjiTableScreen.tutorial_kanji_amount: This number indicates how many kanji are currently being shown.
KanjiTableScreen.tutorial_kanjis: This screen shows you a table of kanji matching different settings. Tapping on one of the kanji will show its details.
KanjiTableScreen.tutorial_sort: This dropdown lets you select an order for the shown kanji.

ManualScreen.anki_connection_test_text:
To start using DaKanji and Anki you need to press the button below. It will check if your setup is correct.

If you get a success message, DaKanji and Anki are connected and you can start using DaKanji with Anki.
ManualScreen.anki_setup_android_text: You need to have [AnkidDroid](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.ichi2.anki&hl=en&gl=US) installed and when asked grant DaKanji permission to interact with Anki.
ManualScreen.anki_setup_desktop_text: On MacOS, Windows and Linux you need to have [Anki](https://apps.ankiweb.net/) installed and [AnkiConnect](https://ankiweb.net/shared/info/2055492159) needs to be [installed and running](https://foosoft.net/projects/anki-connect/).
ManualScreen.anki_setup_general_text:
After you have done the platform-specific setup, please follow the steps below.

1. DaKanji does not add any decks to Anki therefore, you need to head over to the settings and select a deck.
ManualScreen.anki_setup_intro: DaKanji can be used to send notes to Anki. For this, each platform needs a different setup.
ManualScreen.anki_setup_ios_text:
Setup on iOS is a bit cumbersome as AnkiMobile does not allow adding note types, which is possible on Android and desktop. Therefore you need to import an Anki deck with the DaKanji note type (you do not need to do this if you have exported cards from DaKanji to anki on another device)

1. Install [AnkiMobile](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/ankimobile-flashcards/id373493387)
2. Download the pre-made Anki deck from [here](https://github.com/CaptainDario/DaKanji-Dependencies/releases/download/v3.4.0/DaKanji.apkg)
3. Tap on the downloaded file, this will open the import dialog of AnkiMobile
4. Import the deck
5. When asked permit DaKanji to communicate with AnkiMobile and read your clipboard
ManualScreen.anki_test_connection_deck_not_in_anki: The deck you have selected is not available in Anki!
ManualScreen.anki_test_connection_fail: You are not connected to Anki! 😢
ManualScreen.anki_test_connection_no_deck_selected: You do not have a deck selected to which cards should be added, please do so in the settings!
ManualScreen.anki_test_connection_note_type_not_avail: The DaKanji note type is not available in Anki!
ManualScreen.deep_links_text: Deep links are a way to directly link to content in an app. DaKanji provides two schemes for this dakanji:// and http(s)://dakanji.app/app. Using this feature you can for example open the dictionary search when tapping this link dakanji://dictionary?search=食べる. For all supported links see [dakanji.app/deep-links](https://dakanji.app/deep-links)
ManualScreen.dict_kanji_animation_text:
DaKanji can show animated stroke order diagrams of most of the included Kanji / Kana. These animations can be controlled in different ways. 
Double tapping, has different results depending on the current state of the animation. If the animation is currently playing, it will pause it. Similarly, when the animation is currently paused, it will continue playing the animation. Lastly, if the animation has finished, double tapping will restart the animation from the beginning.
By Swiping on the kanji the animation progress can be controlled. Swiping left will rewind the animation while swiping right will advance the animation.
ManualScreen.dict_kanji_copy_radicals_text: You can copy a radical to the clipboard by tapping on it. A double tap will append the radical to the already existing clipboard content.
ManualScreen.dict_kanji_search_kanji_group_text: When a Kanji group can be searched in the dictionary it has a green border. Long pressing will search for it in the dictionary and double tapping will copy it to the clipboard.
ManualScreen.dict_radicals_paste_text: Pressing the paste button in the lower right corner, will search in your system's clipboard for radicals and use them as the current selection.
ManualScreen.dict_search_history_delete_text: You can delete elements from the search history by swiping left on them.
ManualScreen.dict_search_results_navigate_text: You can navigate the search results with the arrow up and down keys. If you want to open a dictionary entry, press enter while it is highlighted.
ManualScreen.dict_text_examples_analyze_text: Examples from the dictionary can be opened in the text processing screen by double tapping on them.
ManualScreen.dict_text_examples_analyze_title: Opening examples in the Text screen
ManualScreen.dojg_image_full_screen_text: Some DoJG entries have an image attached (this is only true when you imported the Anki deck that includes media). Those images can be viewed in full screen by double tapping on them.
ManualScreen.dojg_import_text:
Dictionary of Japanese Grammar (DoJG) is a series of books about Japanese Grammar. DaKanji allows to import its [Anki deck (that you can download here)](https://dojgdeck.neocities.org/) and then search its content.  
It exists in two versions: one with images and one without. You can import either one by first downloading it and then importing it by selecting the .apkg file when asked on the DoJG screen.
ManualScreen.text_selection_grow_text: This button allows you to grow the current text selection. Pressing it once will grow the current selection by one token (word). Long-pressing it will grow the current selection by one character.
ManualScreen.text_selection_left_text: This button allows you to change the current text selection. Pressing it will select the previous token (word). Long-pressing it will select the previous charatcer.
ManualScreen.text_selection_right_text: This button allows you to change the current text selection. Pressing it will select the next token (word). Long-pressing it will select the next charatcer.
ManualScreen.text_selection_shrink_text: This button allows you to shrink the current text selection. Pressing it once will shrink the current selection by one token (word). Long-pressing it will shrink the current selection by one character.
ManualScreen.title: Manual

OnBoarding.Onboarding_1_text: Just draw it and "DaKanji" will show the character you need.
OnBoarding.Onboarding_1_title: You do not know a Kanji?
OnBoarding.Onboarding_2_text: With "DaKanji" you can quickly lookup words using the built-in dictionary or check them on the internet.
OnBoarding.Onboarding_3_text: Use DaKanji's text analysis tools to add furigana, spaces and more, or translate the whole sentence.
OnBoarding.Onboarding_3_title: Do not know how to read a sentence?
OnBoarding.Onboarding_4_text: DaKanji has Kanji and Kana tables to let you study them efficiently.

SettingsScreen.advanced_settings_number_search_procs_bo: When DaKanji searches in its database it uses multiple processes. Usually, 2 is a good value for the standard database included with DaKanji. However, if you experience slow-downs when searching in the database, try using more processes.
SettingsScreen.advanced_settings_optimizing:
Optimizing...
Please do not close the app.
SettingsScreen.advanced_settings_optimze_warning:
This will optimize the Neural Network execution for your device.
This can take a while depending on your device, but can improve the performance of dramatically.
SettingsScreen.anki_get_decks_fail: You are not connected to Anki, could not update decks! 😢
SettingsScreen.dict_deconjugate_body:
This setting enables the 'deconjugation' of verbs, adjectives, and copula. When it is enabled, DaKanji tries to convert the search term into its base form. For example, 食べます、食べられる、食べない all are converted into 食べる.

For intermediate learners, the recommendation is to turn off this setting.
SettingsScreen.dict_disable_english_info: A significant part of the dictionary is only available in English. Disabling it will hide all of those entries.
SettingsScreen.dict_kanaize_body:
When enabling this setting, DaKanji converts any search term to a uniform kana representation before looking it up. This means that the query 'taberu' will be converted to たべる and will find 食べる, but it can also lead to unintended matches.

For example searching 'man' will be converted to まん and therfore, matches 万 and the english word 'man'.

Note: this is a global setting and is applied everywhere the dictionary is used
SettingsScreen.dict_show_word_freq_body:
DaKanji uses word frequency to rank its dictionary entries. This word frequency is an estimation of a word's usage and is based on different data sources:

* Wikipedia, representing encyclopedic text
* Subtitles, from OPUS OpenSubtitles 2018 and SUBTLEX
* Web text, from OSCAR
* Twitter, representing short-form social media
* Reddit, representing potentially longer Internet comments

The number shown in DaKanji is a variation on the actual word frequency called [Zipf frequency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zipf%27s_law) that aims to return the word frequency on a human-friendly logarithmic scale. The Zipf frequency of a word is the base-10 logarithm of the number of times it appears per billion words. A word with Zipf value 6 appears once per thousand words, for example, and a word with Zipf value 3 appears once per million words.
Reasonable Zipf values are between 0 and 8, but the minimum Zipf value appearing in DaKanji is 1.0. We use 0 as the default Zipf value for words that do not appear in the data sources, although it should mean one occurrence per billion words.
[Read more...](https://github.com/rspeer/wordfreq)
SettingsScreen.draw_browser_for_online_dict: Use a webview for web dictionaries
SettingsScreen.kana_table_play_audio: Play audio when tapping on Kana

TextScreen.title: Text
TextScreen.tutorial_begin_text: We will show you a quick tutorial to get you started.
TextScreen.tutorial_colors_text: This button shows the Part of Speech of words in different colors (the meanings of the colors can be seen in the manual).
TextScreen.tutorial_fullscreen_text: This button switches the processed text to full screen.
TextScreen.tutorial_furigana_text: This button adds furigana to the text.
TextScreen.tutorial_processed_text_double_tap: A double tap will select a sentence.
TextScreen.tutorial_processed_text_long_press: A long press will select a word and show the Part of Speech information.
TextScreen.tutorial_processed_text_tap: A single tap will select a word.
TextScreen.tutorial_processed_text_text: The processed text will be shown here. You can select parts of the text to look them up in the dictionary.
TextScreen.tutorial_processed_text_triple_tap: A triple tap will select a paragraph.
TextScreen.tutorial_spaces_text: With this button spaces are added to the text.
TextScreen.tutorial_text_input_text: Here you can write or paste any text. This text can be processed with different tools.

WordListScreen.word_list_copy_other_list: Copy all entries from other lists

WordListsScreen.delete_warning_desc: This will permanently delete this word list, this cannot be undone.
WordListsScreen.no_entries: No entries in this word list
WordListsScreen.title: Word lists
WordListsScreen.tutorial_begin_text: We will show you a quick tutorial to get you started.
WordListsScreen.tutorial_begin_title: Welcome to the word lists screen!
WordListsScreen.tutorial_create_folder:
You can create a new wordlist-folder by either pressing this button or dragging a word list on another one.
You can also rearrange your folders and lists by dragging them.
WordListsScreen.tutorial_create_list: Using this button you can create a new wordlist.
WordListsScreen.tutorial_folder:
This is a wordlist-folder. You can store other wordlist-folders or wordlists in it.
This is also the default word list folder. It contains some word lists based on the JLPT, your search history, etc..
WordListsScreen.tutorial_list:
This is a wordlist. By tapping on it you can see its content.
Using the menu-button on the right side of this list, you can also export your list to different formats.
